snippet: The widespread use of the Web has allowed adoptees and their birth parents to reunite, but it has also brought fraud and other dangers.
abstract: Report by nonprofit organization Evan B Donaldson Adoption Institute finds that widespread use of Internet has allowed adoptees and their birth parents to reunite, opened up adoption process and provided a range of support options, but it has also brought fraud and other dangers.
lead_paragraph: The widespread use of the Web has allowed adoptees and their birth parents to reunite, but it has also brought fraud and other dangers.

headline.seo: Internet Use in Adoptions Cuts 2 Ways, Report Says
headline.main: Internet Use in Adoptions Cuts 2 Ways, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Internet Use In Adoptions Cuts 2 Ways, Report Says
